main.name: Lee Jacobs
main.description: I am a software engineer with experience building and desiging systems from the ground up to solve complex problems. I enjoy systems design and the philosophy of program design
main.bio: I am a native San Diegan. I enjoy fair weather surfing, smaller electronics projects, competitive first person shooters and 3D design. In my free time you can find me behind a computer playing the latest FPS or around my house working on various projects.
main.contactmessage: Contact me if you are looking to hire a senior softare engineer.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Primarily focused on pure mathematics and computer graphics focused cs.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Implement solutions for a variety of scenarios.
tasks: Created an automated iOS deployment platform which compiled, delivered, deployed and maintained over 60 iOS apps. System also record app data and automated updates across all apps.
Big data redshift applications, managing billions of rows per day.
Created system for automating translatability accross all customer facing front end HTML/CSS/JS pages
Created Wordpress plugins to support features across our service.
General full stack work to support both internal and customer facing tools
Interview and assess potential engineering candidates
Review and refactor legacy code to improve functionality and legability

work.title: Developer
work.description: Provide backend and frontend solutions for clients in web development and iOS app development spaces.
tasks: Create and maintain iOS applications in Swift
Create web services that fulfill customer requirements

projects.title: Curse Generator
projects.category: An attempt to create a grammatically correct insult/curse generator

projects.title: SQL2-GUI
projects.category: A misguided attempt to implement html rendering in Opengl 3.x for SDL2 UIs

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
